intro: Eriogonum niveum var. decumbens, commonly known as the snowbrush buckwheat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. This species plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
